getAccount.description: The getaccount RPC returns the name of the account associated with the given address.

address.description: A P2PKH or P2SH Bitcoin address belonging either to a specific account or the default account (“”)

result.description: The name of an account, or an empty string (“”, the default account)

getWalletInfo.description: The getwalletinfo RPC provides information about the wallet.

getBlockChainInfo.description: The getblockchaininfo RPC provides information about the current state of the block chain.

getNewAddress.description: The getnewaddress RPC returns a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments. If an account is specified, payments received with the address will be credited to that account.

account.description: The name of the account to put the address in. The default is the default account, an empty string (“”)

addressType.description: The address type to use. Options are ‘legacy’, ‘p2sh-segwit’, and ‘bech32’. Default is set by -addresstype

result.description: A P2PKH address which has not previously been returned by this RPC. The address will be marked as a receiving address in the wallet. The address may already have been part of the keypool, so other RPCs such as the dumpwallet RPC may have disclosed it previously. If the wallet is unlocked, its keypool will also be filled to its max (by default, 100 unused keys). If the wallet is locked and its keypool is empty, this RPC will fail

getInfo.description: the getinfo RPC prints various information about the node and the network.

result.description: information about the node and network

abandonTransaction.description: The abandontransaction RPC marks an in-wallet transaction and all its in-wallet descendants as abandoned. This allows their inputs to be respent.

TXID.description: The TXID of the transaction that you want to abandon. The TXID must be encoded as hex in RPC byte order

result.description: JSON null when the transaction and all descendants were abandoned
